properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 1 at 4:55PM PST until February 2 at 1:02PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County

Up to 4 and half inches of rain fell in the headwaters of the
Cowlitz River in this latest storm. With the additional of some
lower elevation snow melt, this amount of water will drive the
Cowlitz River at Randle to near flood stage.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Cowlitz River At Randle
* from this evening to Sunday afternoon.
* At  4:45 PM Saturday the stage was 16.4 feet.
* Flood stage is 18.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage around 9 PM
Saturday and crest near 18.2 feet around 10 PM Saturday. The river
will fall below flood stage early Sunday morning.
* Impact...At 18.0 feet, the Cowlitz River will cause minor flooding
from the vicinity of Randle downstream through Riffe Lake...
covering nearby farm lands and several roads.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
